Reviews.Title: “Not outstanding, but has good features.”
Reviews.Author: ShaMom2
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here last Friday night. We had reservations to see "Hairspray" at Toby's Dinner Theater (which is right inside the hotel) and didn't want to make the 2-hour drive home after the show, so we elected to stay overnight. Check-in went smoothly, and our room was fine. We almost took the free hotel shuttle to the Inner Harbor, but decided to stay in the room and relax before the show. Parking at the Inner Harbor can be expensive, so the shuttle is great to have available. I'll keep it in mind for the future. If I could split up my rating, I would give their breakfast only 1 star. They have free breakfast and I must say, it was one of the worst I've ever had. The scrambled eggs were terrible. They were yellow, which was the only thing about them that resembled eggs. I took one bite and almost spit it out. They were just awful. They have one waffle maker, and the line of people to use it was very long. Since each waffle takes about 3 minutes, you can do the math to figure out how long you'd have to wait if you are 6th or 7th (or even more) in line. I wound up with just a bowl of cereal and a cup of orange juice. They have an indoor pool and fitness center which we didn't use, so I can't comment on them. I do like that they're there and may plan to stay longer in the future. The dinner theater is very nice. We've seen several shows there, and they are professional quality. Dinner is typical buffet dinner. One fun thing is that the actors are the servers, so you get to know them before the show goes on, which gives a personal feel to watching the show. Overall, the experience was good and I would go back. We would use breakfast for just something light like toast, juice and coffee. If we were there for more than just overnight we'd definitely use the pool and fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: joynpain829
Reviews.Content: I am skeptical of any hotel in the Baltimore area, but this one was clean and very comfortable. The bed spreads could use updating and the front desk staff was not particularly nice, but I did not have to interact with them much. The breakfast was decent, not the best I've had. On weekdays there was an omelet station, which was a nice treat. The hotel looked big, but felt small. I would stay here again when visiting Baltimore. You definitely need a car to visit any attractions.

Reviews.Title: “A lot of bang for cheap price.”
Reviews.Author: sailaway22
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night with couples. We went to the inner harbor and came back to just sleep. Beds were comfty, clean, and quiet. I have to say the man up front Kal was so helpful with every request I had. If you need to get things done ask for him! He made personal calls all night for my late transportation needs! Complimentary breakfast was good for being free. The Waffle machine was a hit =)

Reviews.Title: “Shuttle service is GREAT”
Reviews.Author: PSUCoasterfan
Reviews.Content: This review of 4 stars (or circles, or whatever tripadvisor uses) is a mixed review. I would give the hotel rooms a 2-3 star rating. I would give the shuttle service a 5+ star rating. The rooms (at least our room) was a bit dated. The toilet didn't always flush easily and the shower filled with water. It wasn't a TERRIBLE experience, but it was far from luxurious. From reading other reviews, it sounds like some rooms are better than others, however. The shuttle service, however, was excellent. It was so convenient to just keep our car parked in the parking lot and take the shuttle to the Inner Harbor every day. No traffic woes, no parking fees, no getting lost, etc. Coming back to the hotel on the shuttle one evening, my 7-year old son asked the driver for a tour. The driver then gave an impromptu (and hilarious) narrative as he drove us back to the hotel. My son had a blast. My wife and I were in stitches as well. Would I stay here again? For $100/night and a free shuttle service -- YOU BET.

Reviews.Title: “Hot Tub Suites”
Reviews.Author: JayDive
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend the Hot Tub suite, room 1103 with the view of Baltimore skyline, worth the extra money. Even the normal room for our daughter and kids, room 1120 was spacious. The heated (85 degrees) indoor pool was a hit with me and the grand kid. There was a Life guard on duty until 10PM. The gym was great and just off the swimming pool. The free breakfast was better than Embassy Suites. The kids loved making their own waffles. The dinner theater in the hotel was an awesome treat. The only suite room complaint is the couch was old and needed replacing. The in house restaurant was average but the lady restaurant manager Theresa was great. The level of all hotel management and staff was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western - Great place to stay in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: Poudre1
Reviews.Content: Arrived 2 days prior to a cruise on 1-14-12. The cab fare from Airport to BW was around $45.00 for the four of us so we took the MTA from the airport. Total cost for the four of us was $2.20 to inner harbor where we were picked up by BW free shuttle. Train ride took about 20 min and saved a bunch. The hotel was very nice, very clean and there were zero problems the entire stay. The free hot breakfast each morning was very good with scr. eggs, waffles, toast, fruits and more. We utilized the free shuttle to inner harbor for great sight seeing such as the old ships, the National aquarium and many great places to eat and drink. You really need to at least have drink at Dicks. What a hoot! The hotel restaurant food is good and not to pricey as was the in house bar. The work out area and pool were great. We paid a total (including taxes) of $102.51 per night each room, King, floor 12. Cab fare to cruise ship was $30.00 for up to four people. There is not a free shuttle provided to cruise ship by this BW. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value”
Reviews.Author: BestViews
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before we left on a cruise out of the Port of Baltimore. The hotel is a bit older but it's clean and the rooms are of a good size and quiet. The staff and service were very good. The included breakfast was basic but satisfying. Kids will love making their own waffles. The hotel included free parking for our car while we were on the ship and also free shuttle service to and from the hotel and the port. Next time, we will stay a few extra days at the hotel and get to know Baltimore a bit more. Can't beat this value.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Rehoboth2
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a place for my wife's birthday celebration. I wanted near Baltimore, but not deep in the "heart" of the city. I could not have made a better selection. The service, facility, and all levels of management and staff were just outstanding in the performace of their duties. I would recommend this specific location without any reservations. I cannot over express my pleasures. I even thought that the pricing for the banquet and rooms were very reasonable. They made good on all promises. My guests were extremely pleased and the food was GREAT. Quality and Quanity

Reviews.Title: “Great Low Price Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sugarpod
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Baltimore for interviews and was very impressed by the Best Western. Although the hotel is not situated in the friendliest part of town, the staff was friendly and helpful (especially the hotel shuttle drivers!) and amenities included a hot breakfast every morning and free hotel shuttle service to all of the local hospitals and even the downtown Baltimore area. I highly recommend staying here if you are on a tight budget but would still like to get the most out of your city visit!

Reviews.Title: “Treated as a Guest Always”
Reviews.Author: Sean1993
Reviews.Content: I have to say, I experienced the best service at this hotel I've ever had in my life. I was visiting my friend at Johns Hopkins University, however, after a strange experience with the Chinatown bus company, I was left stranded in Baltimore travel plaza. I walked into Best Western, hoping they could give me directions to the University. However, after speaking with the front desk clerk, I learned the University was almost impossible to get to via public transportation. After finding out a cab would cost more than $50, I was in panic. I am a college student after all, and operating on a tight budget. However, the front desk clerk, Kal, couldn't have been more helpful. He was driving a guest to Johns Hopkins Hospital and said he'd give me a ride as well. He didn't have to do that. I wasn't a guest at the hotel and he had no responsibility to help me out. Yet, he did it anyway. He talked to me and calmed me down and directed me to someone in the hospital, who knew where the free shuttle to the University was located. Without his help, I would have been stranded in Baltimore. I am eternally grateful for the amazing service I received at the Best Western Plus and if I'm ever in Baltimore I can guarantee, I will be staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but no outside service.”
Reviews.Author: EmilyStacy
Reviews.Content: On the first might of my honeymoon, my husband and I drove up to Baltimore to spend the night before leaving on a cruise the next day. The hotel is very clean and nice.The front desk staff are very nice. However, after the front desk called two different cab companies, no cab showed up after an hour of waiting. We don't know the area, and did not want to be driving around on what should be a stress free evening trying to find a good restaurant. We gave up waiting and went to the hotel restaurant. 15 minutes later, no one had come to wait on us so we chose to walk across the street to the McDonalds. At least they provided some service! Very sad that a huge chain and nice hotel has zero relationship status with local taxi companies. My husband will make sure this hotel is taken off his company's "places to stay" list.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and Accessible”
Reviews.Author: echappell86
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while I was visiting Baltimore for a concert. This hotel is located no more than 13 minutes from 1st Marina Arena. The staff were friendly and helped us when needed. They have free wifi and a free breakfast buffett. The rooms were neat and clean. You can tell the hotel has done some upgrades in the past couple of years. The bed was very comfortable and I loved the pillows. I slept very well! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: KCashVa
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 1030am and were allowed to check in that early! The rooms are a little bit small for 3 people but not a big deal at all. We got a room on the 8th floor with a pretty good view. The bathroom is spacious. All appliances, TV and climate control worked very well. Beds were very comfortable and we had plenty of pillows and blankets. The free buffet breakfast is OK. They have two hot items (same eggs and sausage every day), lots of bread and donuts, cereal, waffles and fruit. There is plenty of space in the restaurant for everyone to be seated. The indoor pool was chilly, but clean. The hot tub was broken and we were very disappointed about that. The cleaning staff is very nice and very thorough. We tried to use the shuttle to the inner harbor, but it was full, so we drove. Kind of disappointed about that. For the price, its a very nice Best Western and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful sky line and breackfast too!”
Reviews.Author: rkoerner39
Reviews.Content: not a bad place to stay . the rooms are clean. lots of parking. the breaskfast is great (free) eat all you want . close to downtown and close to the county side kind of in the middle . a little on the pricey side but nice .pool ,and work out room .

Reviews.Title: “Accommodating!”
Reviews.Author: Angela H
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable, professional staff and a great area! Good value and not one complaint as I took a group to this location for 4 days.

Reviews.Title: “very nice, but watch the price”
Reviews.Author: Meatman1947
Reviews.Content: booked this room on priceline.com. thought it was unusual that i didn't pay for this room upfront like all other priceline purchases. when we got to this hotel, which is kinda hard to get to, we checked in and they added 25 dollars worth of taxes on the bill. makes them look a lot cheaper when they do that.on the other hand it was a super room, very musty, but we always take room freshener with us. a great free breakfast also.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: gma6times
Reviews.Content: We had a very good experience at the Best Western. We stayed here because we have never had a problem with Best Western hotels and we had a $50 gift card that was issued to us because we had stayed on consecutive nights in the spring. That is a nice incentive that Best Western offers. The hotel is about 15 minutes away from the Inner Harbor. They offer a free shuttle service which dropped us off and picked us up at the Harbor. It also goes to the Convention Center and Johns Hopkins. Our driver, Arnold, was very punctual and pleasant. This service saved us a lot on parking. Our room was very clean and modern. The beds were very comfortable. Staff was friendly and informative. There is a very nice continental breakfast which included extra touches like blueberry waffles and warm maple syrup. There is also a restaurant, entertainment theater fitness center, conference center, and pool on the property. No complaints at all about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for Johns Hopkins paients”
Reviews.Author: MaryZ
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because my husband was scheduled for surgery at Johns Hopkins' Bayview Medical Center---about 200 miles from our home. The hospital provided us with their list of recommended hotels and the Best Western was included. The hotel is in an unattractive area of Baltimore, but I did not feel unsafe. There is a bus stop and a truck plaza nearby, but the property is not surrounded by 'barbed wire' as mentioned by another reviewer. The hotel is somewhat dated in its decoration, but I found the public areas and our 6th floor room to be clean throughout our 4-day stay. Because we were there for medical treatment, we were given a room on the 6th floor---the 'Johns Hopkins Floor'---which also included a guest laundry, and a lounge area for patients and families. I believe the hotel also tries to provide a quiet atmosphere on this floor, something they did quite successfully. Although there is a shuttle available, that service doesn't begin until 7:00 a.m. We had to be at the hospital earlier, so we drove ourselves. It's a fairly easy drive to the hospital which is less than 10 minutes away. We relied on the Tradewinds restaurant each night for room service dinners during our stay. The speed of the service varied with the day, but the servers were invariably kind and pleasant. The quality of the food was OK, probably better than the McDonald's across the parking lot. I was grateful for the microwave and refrigerator in our room, and we used them both. We chose this hotel because of its proximity to Johns Hopkins, and the special accommodations it makes for medical patients. I wouldn't stay there if I were visiting Baltimore for other reasons because I found the location to be so unattractive. I did not, however, have complaints about our hotel service.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Janette W
Reviews.Content: My parents booked their 50th wedding anniversary celebration here, where all 5 of their children, spouses, and 7 grandchildren would be staying. They had a signed contract stating the dates, room block, dinner in Tradewinds one night and dinner in Harbor room A another night, and they had to put down a $200.00 deposit. Upon arrival, the front desk had no record of their reservations, so none of our rooms were together as stated in the contract. Second, dinner for 11 travel weary people took over an hour to be served in the Tradewinds restaurant, and the food was frozen food you would buy in any grocery store freezer. When my brother arrived as a guaranteed late arrival at 8:00pm, the room he was given was filthy and hadn't been cleaned. After 20 minutes, he was finally upgraded. As a surprise for my parents, we booked a professional photographer to take familt portraits. My sister called the hotel and spoke to Janet Campbell, who was supposed to handle the event. She said since Harbor Room A was booked for the dinner, we could have pictures taken in there. The hotel, who had a copy of the contract, refused to let us have the room and we had to have pictures taken outsidein high humidity with mosquitoes biting our legs. Then, we had to have my parents Golden Anniversary dinner in the Tradewinds restaurant with no privacy. Our dinners took over an hour to arrive, and then they arrived piece meal. 5 came out first, then 15 minutes later another 5, then 20 minutes later another five and so on until the last dinner came out a full two houes after our order was taken. We had to argue to see a manager, and finally Therea Ash spoke to us. She was rude, unsympathetic, and offerd us 10% off. When we said it wasn't acceptable, she tried to intimidate us by saying we had to pay wether we took the discount or not. Afterwards, my brother went to his room with his family only to find a mouse in his room. The hotel joked it was th hotel mouse named Chester, but noone was amused. He was offered another upgrade, but in the end house keeping shoved steel wool under the air conditioner. When my parents checked out, they complained to yet another manager, Chadi, who said he would comp them my brother's room, which he did but never took off the $200.00 deposit my parents paid, so they basically received no compensation. I should also mention housekeeping doesn't make the rooms up until 3:30pm, so the day we were trying to get ready for our photo shoot at 4:00pm, our rooms were never made since we were in them when the maids wanted to clean them, and they never returned.This was one of the WORST experiences we had, what should have been a wonderful weekend was hampered by this hotel and it's incompetant staff. I'd NEVER stay here again, and I warn all others to stay away!!!!!! P.S. The hotel is surrounded by barbed wire and next to a truck stop, which you don't see in the pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: cdnmr
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed for 2 mights as part of the stay and cruise package (second night was because of Hurricane Irene). Room 1106-smelled very damp the first night, much better after the AC was left on for the entire first day/night. Bathroom was pitiful, whoever does their repairs/maintenance should be fired, they don't know what they're doing and it shows. There was an issue with the shower overflowing onto the bathroom floor so they cut a piece of white plastic pipe in half and glued it to the floor. The caulking (all over the bathroom) was either missing entirely or appeared to be installed by someone who has never seen a tube of caulk before! lol Toilet only flushed if you held the handle for the duration of the flush. The shower was for physically challenged people and was stuck at waist height. You had to hold the shower piece in your hand, you could not leave it on the wall. (not a deal breaker but an annoyance). Beds were pretty good (tons of pillows) and the rest of the room was clean. The AC was very loud, it didn't bother me but anyone who likes it very quiet would not be able to sleep with it on. (I assume not all AC units were this loud) The restaurant was a comedy show. All of the ladies that work there seem very sweet and appear to be doing their best but with 2 waitresses and 1 water pourer with 30-40 people in the dining room they are stretched far too thin. I tipped them because I realized they were trying but understaffed. We waited over 30 minutes the 2 times we ate there besides breakfast. The first night we waited 15 minutes to get a soft drink with only 2 other tables occupied. Our last dinner we waited until 515pm and no one would let customers in (they open at 5pm) so we drove over to Outback Steakhouse around 10 mins away). When you have as many people working the front desk as working the restaurant there is a problem. Breakfast was pretty good, big line at the waffle iron but lots of other choices available. They didnt refill the coffee pot until customers told them it was empty, in my opinion you monitor this stuff on your own and refill it before the customers complain. Free internet was poor, had to re-login dozens of times (I work in IT), decent connection but kept dropping. For a single night if you just want a place to sleep and don't mind a place in need of an overhaul and get it cheap then go for it. If you want your money's worth this place is not worth more than $70/night in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “will be back”
Reviews.Author: Nessa C
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband were taking a long awaited alone time away from the children, so we took a ride to Baltimore from New York ,because my husband is a big fan of baseball The Yankee's to be excact and we were told that the Travel Plaza has a free shuttle to and from the harbor and the stadium so we caught a game .This was great to go out and not worry about driving. We got a great rate and the free breakfast was very classy and plentyful the attendents were the friendlest i've seen in a long while. We will defently be back this is going to be our new thing to do. Rooms and lobby were also very nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: Ragroug
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a wedding and stayed at this Best Western. The free shuttle was great and took us within a few blocks of the reception. The great thing was the rate! The Downtown hotels were charging almost double the rate we paid here AND the parking was free. The clean rooms and the free breakfast were the icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for the money”
Reviews.Author: Duchesses
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because of its easy accessibility to Johns Hopkins and the shuttle/discount offered (call for the medical discount, I think it was $89). While it's not in the prettiest part of town for sure, the hotel itself is very nice and the staff very accomodating. Our room was very large & clean, and once you turn on the a/c unit it cools down pretty quickly. We did realize in the middle of the night that the a/c wasn't cooling properly, but then again this intense heat wave might have something to do with that so it wasn't too big of a deal for us. Johns Hopkins and Inner Harbour are an easy 12-minute drive or hotel shuttle away. Overall it was a great value for the $$ for our situation and I can recommend the hotel as a clean, comfortable, friendly place to stay if you don't want to spend a fortune.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but Rude Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: sveetbananna
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very average. The room was clean but smelled very musky and moldy when we walked in and the front desk girl was very snippy and rude. We also witnessed her being rude to other hotel guests. Also, the rooms only have one outlet near the desk. There are no other free outlets in the room except the bathroom. The free breakfast was pretty good, but nothing extraordinary. All in all, if you don't have a run-in with front desk, a cheap choice.

Reviews.Title: “Park and Cruise Package”
Reviews.Author: RCDS_Family
Reviews.Content: We were travelling with our 2 kids and booked the park and cruise package from an outside website. Package includes accomodation, parking, shuttle to and from the port, and breakfast. There was also a free shuttle to and from the harbor which we did not use. Shuttle times need to be reserved. Property is right off the Interstate in what seemed to be a mix of industrial and residential. The hotel is located in a closed travel plaza. There is a McDonalds on the property. We felt safe while on the property and parking is right outside the hotel doors away from the closed travel plaza. Hotel lobby is nice with friendly staff. Pool and fitness area were in good shape. Pool and fitness area have nice thick towels right in the area. Full breakfast buffet was good and there was a lot of seating. We had a room with 2 beds. Our room also had a fridge and micro. Room was clean but there was a very stong musty/chemical smell. Having the air conditioning on helped a little but as soon as the air conditioner was shut off, the smell was back with a vengance. Because we had unpacked and the hotel was full we did not complain. If we stayed again, I would ask for another room if we encountered the same smell. The shuttle to and from the cruise port was contracted out to an outside company who did an OK job. Cruise port was only 5-10 min door to door. There was a 10-15 min wait for the shuttle (9 person van) to pick us up after the cruise. Overall we would recommed this hotel for a quick overnight stay especially as a park and cruise option.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hopkins recommendation”
Reviews.Author: Shery1234
Reviews.Content: I am so glad the Johns Hopkins people recommended this Hotel. My husband was undergoing treatment at Johns Hopkins and we had to stay in Baltimore for several weeks. From the Front Desk staff to our Room Attendant and the Shuttle driver, everyone was so nice. The waitress in the Restaurant greeted us every morning and took the time to chat with us when she had a few minutes. There’s also a nice variety for breakfast so we could have eggs & sausage one morning, a Belgian waffle another day, and cereal yet another day. The free shuttle took us right to our building on the Bayview Campus and picked us up in the afternoon. Hopefully, the treatment was successful and we won’t have to go back to Johns Hopkins, but when we are heading to Baltimore, we will definitely use the Best Western Plus on O’Donnell St.

Reviews.Title: “loved it, will go back”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler29750
Reviews.Content: I have been to the hotel several time in the past and i love it. I love the idea of the dinner theater and hotel together. I live in new jersey and have family in baltimore and i always stay at this hotel. We get together to watch a show & have dinner. Its clean, all the staff is friendly, and i also like the idea of the shuttle to take you down to the harbor for free. I have seen beauty and the beast (twice) grease and Dream Girls, me and my family love it. The shows are amazing, very talented people.

Reviews.Title: “Good location if you want to visit Baltimore's inner harbor”
Reviews.Author: AlexLIfen
Reviews.Content: I think the reason why this place is a good location is because of its free shuttle bus to both John Hopkins Hospital and to the Inner Harbor. It takes a while to get there, but then again, we have to compromise too if you want to do this within a budget. It took i think a good 30 minutes to get into the harbor, because it has to go to the hospital. In the inner harbor, you will be dropped off at the Pier 5 hotel, its a very decent place, so you can actually hand around there while waiting for the van to pick you up again. The only thing is, some reviewers here got to take some responsibility to ask questions anywhere they go, since it is a free shuttle, chances are it will be filled. so ask the time and make reservations going to and back, why complain when you are not acting responsibly to ask the what is and what not. By the way, the shuttle only sits approximately 10 to 12 people. As for the hotel itself, on the first floor, it has the look and feel of a very cheap hotel in the mid-80s feeling, which is not really a good thing, first impression always lasts. the gift shop is sad, its like teller booth with some racks of goodies behind it. I wonder, they got so much space, but it was not really utilize. and basically this floor needs updating pretty soon. no matter how good the food is, eating off a dirty plate is not how you would enjoy it. As for the room, well, be aware that there is a handicap room, because i was sent into that room, although i didn't picked this room (i booked online), so it was weird to see the bathroom. lets leave it at that. I asked politely the next day to move me into another room, which they kindly did. I was moved to room 1104, it was nice actually. but nothing like the one you will see in the pictures found in the hotel's website. But mainly, the room has NO bad weird stinky smell, clean, no bedbugs. It has ample lightings, bathroom was clean and adequate, bed is comfortable, no spring sticking on your back, tons of soft pillows, got microwave, ref but no toothpaste, no shaver in this room, unlike the handicap room, has both of them. perhaps the cleaning crew forget to put them in. Not an issue anyway, just noticed it. For the breakfast in Tradewind inside the hotel. it was nice. of course do not think this is embassy suites where there is a cook to do your sunny side up. But it is decent, hot sausages, potatoes or eggs, some waffle you do your own, coffee, different pastries and juices. one thing i guess i would recommend what this hotel do with the breakfast is, is to invest on a good coffee. it will go along way. and its not gonna cost more than what you have right now. Overall, i will come back, hopefully management will see this review and make some changes. As for other reviewers who wrote nasty things, ask the front desk politely, they will help, if the one you talk to didn't help, go for the next person. Chances are they will help you out. As for other travellers who want to try this, Go ahead and use this. The only downside i guess is actually not the hotel, but area. there is no real nice restaurant to eat within a walking distance, there are some like within a few miles which requires to drive.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising service, will use it on the way back”
Reviews.Author: SaraRamada
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Best Western. We were traveling along I-95 and didn’t have reservations, but decided to stop there. We were pleasantly surprised with the warm greeting and excellent service received at this hotel and would recommend it to anyone wanting a clean, comfortable hotel. The young lady at the Front Desk was professional and courteous and made us feel welcome. We checked into a very nice room with a beautiful marble shower, a microwave and a refrigerator. We loved the beds and the pillows! Our stay included breakfast in the hotel restaurant and we didn’t go away hungry. They had Belgian waffles, scrambled eggs, sausage, and lots more. Needless to say, we will not hesitate to stay here again when we’re traveling along I-95. We may even plan to stay for a couple nights and use the hotel’s free shuttle to tour the Inner Harbor in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “VERY Accomodating Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tina56_8
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week while my husband was being treated at Johns Hopkins. Not only did they offer a reduced rate for Hopkins patients and their families, but everyone at the hotel went out of their way to make the time as comfortable and pleasant as possible. Although there was a large convention at the time I stayed and the hotel was fully booked, I was given preference when I needed to extend my stay. The front-desk manager took time from his busy morning to re-set my laptop for me and the shuttle drivers were efficient and kind. The restaurant offered really good food at reasonable prices and I was even able to work out at the gym. The room was immaculate and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Johns Hopkins visit - excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: trucksvc
Reviews.Content: In spite of several negative reviews, I found this hotel to be an excellent choice for a visit to Johns Hopkins. The room charge was very reasonable, reservation and check-in process (even early) was seamless and the front desk was friendly and helpful. My room on the 12th floor was clean, refurbished with nice linens and furniture, flat screen tv, safe, microwave, coffee maker and good sized mini refrigerator. The shuttle service was on-time and the service was helpful and friendly. A 45-minute notice is necessary to transportation (free) to Johns Hopkins locations as well as the convention center and the Inner Harbor shopping and restaurant area. IMPORTANT: The attached BUS STATION is now CLOSED so the problems mentioned in previous reviews have completely gone away. There is a 24-hour McDonalds right across the parking area from the hotel, and the hotel's restaurant is small but clean with an ample (and reasonable) menu selection. There is a cozy bar at the entrance to the restaurant with full service. The hotel also offers room service. If you are planning a visit to Johns Hopkins, you can't go wrong with this hotel. They are used to Johns Hopkins visitors and were very helpful. I used KD Elite for airport transportation (phone number provided by reservations) and saved over a cab.

Reviews.Title: “The Return of the Eyeglasses”
Reviews.Author: Delmarva2
Reviews.Content: On 3/31/11 my husband & I stayed at the Best Western as we had a medical procedure on 4/1/11 and wanted to stay in Baltimore due to the lengthy drive from our home. In the morning when we checked out, my husband realized that he could not find his eyeglasses. Due to our time frame at Johns Hopkins, we left and were assured by staff at the Best Western that they would do a thorough search and inform us of their findings. Not only did they find the glasses, they insisted on mailing them overnight to us on the Eastern Shore (an hour and a half from Baltimore) so we would not have to return. During our stay at the hotel we ate at the restaurant for an evening meal and breakfast on the day we left and it was very nice. They also have a dinner theater which we will go to next time ! THANKS SO MUCH FOR THE EXTRA ATTENTION TO DETAIL.

Reviews.Title: “A tale of two parts”
Reviews.Author: Nomolos
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of great things about this place and a few bad things. I have stayed here a few times. It is the only half decent hotel in the Dundalk area of Baltimore. They offer free shuttles to the Inner Harbour but not to the airport. There is a dinner theatre in the hotel which shares its Kitchen with the hotel restaurant, so the food is very good. The bar is ok, but it is kind of stuck at the entrance to the restaurant. The hotel used to also serve as the Grayhound terminus, and had a few fast food places in the terminus, but that has now closed. The rooms are adequet, and very resonably priced. I had a problem on this visit with the restaurant closing 15 minutes early and refusiing to serve me, but the manager came out and talked to me, and dealt with the situation camly, prefessionaly and pleasantly, turning the whole situation into a positive.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: wlwCoralSprings
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the week of Thanksgiving visiting our youngest son who is in school there. We upgraded to a suite and found the extra money well spent. The staff at the hotel is the best. They were able to accomodate our every request including loaning us the tape dispenser from the front desk to assist in wrapping some presents. The parking is plentiful, well lighted, close and free which is a plus considering that many places in Baltimore charge for parking. Access to all the major areas of interest is easy. The free breakfast is also a plus because it is so much more than the typical continental breakfast most places provide. The BW breakfast includes meat, eggs and the regular breakfast items. The dining room staff is also excellent. The only down side is the facility is old and needs some refurbishing and updating. The clientele at the bus terminal are not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: melissa328
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 1 night in December for a little getaway. We had actually earned a free night and chose Baltimore because we live only an hour and a half drive from there. We have been to Baltimore before, but not for many years. We found the hotel with no problem and arrived at 10:00 in the morning. Check-in is not until much later, but the girls at the front desk were extremely nice and helpful. There were rooms available and they let us check in!! They explained all of the amenities and answered numerous questions for me. Jennifer was one of the girls and I didn't catch the other girl's name, but both were extremely friendly and gave us a lot of information and recommendations. We arranged for the free shuttle to take us into the city at 11:00 and went to our room. The room was very clean, roomy and had many nice features. The shuttle dropped us off and we spent a great day in the city visiting Lexington Market, the inner harbor, the aquarium, Federal Hill, Fels Point and having a delicious dinner in Little Italy. We called and arranged for the shuttle to pick us up. We had to wait about 40 minutes, which was fine because we stopped at a great bakery and had some pastries while we were waiting. We came back to the hotel and then went to visit Charm City Cakes where they film Ace of Cakes on the Food Network and we drove to 34th street to see the crazy street with all of the lights, blow up figures, hubcap trees and craziness. It was fun. We came back and relaxed at the hotel and watched TV. There seemed to be a nice restaurant at the hotel with some reasonably priced specials. We did not eat at the hotel. We had a good night's sleep and had breakfast on Sunday morning. The breakfast was very good. Seneca, who was the hostess could not have been nicer. She was really friendly and attentive. All of the food was good. Scrambled eggs, home fries, sausage, make your own belguim waffles, muffins, danish, cereals, lots of bread, bagels and english muffins for toasting. They had coffee, tea, oatmeal, juices and hot chocolate. There is defintely something for everyone and the dishes were cleared as soon as you were done. Overall, this was an excellent Best Western and we have stayed in many Best Western motels. The staff was very accomodating and friendly. The hotel was clean, the rooms were spacious and the breakfast was very good. The only thing I would say that was disappointing is that the pool was out of service. Although, this was no big deal for us, since we weren't planning on swimming, but someone who was expecting to swim might be disappointed. The fact that the hotel is near a bus staion was really no big deal. Although we were not in the middle of the inner harbor, the free shuttle was great and saved us from driving and having to pay for parking. All in all, a great little getaway. Thanks Best Western!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value with convenient complimentary shuttle”
Reviews.Author: TTFIV
Reviews.Content: Recently I had to take my brother for a short stay at Johns Hopkins Hospital. This Best Western has an agreement with the hospital to accommodate the families of admitted patients. The hotel is about a twenty minute drive from the hospital entrance, but the complimentary shuttle service runs every hour and gives door to door service. That sure beats driving and having to pay to park blocks from the hospital, especially when you consider that this world class hospital is located in a very dangerous part of the city. The Baltimore police refer to this area as “the War Zone.” The hospital (or the city police) have actually placed elevated glass guard towers at each intersection for a two block radius where 24 hour armed police officers can protect the hospital visitors. A murder in broad daylight took place two blocks from the hospital entrance while we were there. The guard on that corner told us that it was the 22nd murder in the neighborhood in just two weeks. I only mention all this to emphasize how much we appreciated staying away from that area at the Best Western but with all the safety and convenience of the shuttle. The staff at the Best Western couldn’t have been more accommodating. We arrived at the hotel around eleven PM on a Sunday and the desk staff was still able to direct us to a nearby seafood restaurant for a midnight meal. Traveling with my brother is always embarrassing. He is usually a mean, crude, old cuss. Even with all the insults and complaints he threw at them this Best Western staff somehow remained polite, helpful and professional. The room was well lit and very nicely furnished – comfortable king bed, reclining wing chair, fridge, microwave, desk and swivel chair. The bath was large and clean. The hotel is showing a little age but it is still well kept. There was a lovely view of the city skyline from the room. The complimentary breakfast buffet was OK. It had the usually found processed scrambled eggs, sausage and hash browns, with waffles, bagels, fruit, cereal, coffee and juice. It was certainly enough to get your day started. The hotel is a large complex that also contains a dinner theatre and bus station. Neither of these was a distraction during our stay. Parking was free and right outside the entrance. If I were going back for hospital business I would definitely stay here again for the convenience and excellent rate that they have worked out with Johns Hopkins. If I were coming back to Baltimore to visit the Inner Harbor or attend a ball game I would probably spend a little more and stay in a nicer place downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenster11174
Reviews.Content: I usually read reviews before staying at a hotel, and probably would not have stayed here after reading them, except that my boyfriend is the one that booked it. I was driving in to visit him and was quite nervous about driving into Baltimore alone (just with trusty GPS) but I pulled off of I95 and into the hotel parking lot and it was well-lit, had a McDonald's on the other side, and a T and A across the road. I walked into a beautiful lobby (without being scared) and went to our room which was also beautiful. The bathroom was amazingly clean, as well as the room. We had a tv/computer set-up, fridge, microwave, king bed, couch, coffee table, etc. It was on the top floor and an executive room. I saw no bugs or remnants of bugs. As for the neighborhood, we walked to a local bar around the corner and behind the hotel (used the GPS to find it) and it had inexpensive drinks and a nice local bar atmosphere with friendly staff (Angle Bar, I think?). He ate breakfast, I slept through it, so I dont know what it was like. Overall, a good hotel choice for us.

Reviews.Title: “this worked out great for us!”
Reviews.Author: fmg120
Reviews.Content: off the beaten path, but more reasonable than the inner harbor , free parking and the shuttle ran every 20 mnutes til nine at night so no problem going to the harbor. the pool was great, nice and warm, pool attendant was a great guy. room was clean, roomy and had a view of the city. bus terminal next door was no problem whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Goo experience”
Reviews.Author: bannok23
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to BWI. Room is good condition. The only complaint was the shuttle driver took almost an hour to pick us up from the airport, even though when we call the front desknperson said about 15minutes.

Reviews.Title: “I DON'T KNOW WHAT YOU GUYS SAW...”
Reviews.Author: msroach
Reviews.Content: I don't know what you other people saw when you stayed at this hotel - especially Feared for your Lives or whatever, but this hotel was wonderful. So what if it's near the Greyhound and only fast food is in the area, go eat somewhere else, because it is close to the Inner Harbor, and GPS can take you to another restaurant. The hotel was wonderful, clean, and i didn't see any fat roaches when I dined in the restaurant. I just think people have overexaggerated their reviews, just because the hotel is located next to a Greyhound pit stop. This hotel is nice, and I will be staying there when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Poor choice of hotel”
Reviews.Author: cbvm1
Reviews.Content: Our first night we arrived late (approx. 8:30 p.m.) and were placed in room 720 - this room was supposed to be non-smoking but upon opening the door- stale cigarette smoke smell was present - stains on the ceiling in the bathroom and multiple burn marks in the center of the carpet of the room confirmed this. The wall beside the bed had two huge indentions with cracks in the plaster which appeared to be from some trauma (something being slammed into it). There was a constant dripping sound all night long either from the refrigerator or in the wall behind the refrigerator. Also, went to make coffee and the machine was dirty - had the grounds in the coffee maker from previous tenant still in the basket and the carafe had dried up coffee remnants. The overall cleanliness of this room was questionable. Needless to say we asked for a different room the next day and were moved two doors down to 718 the following night. In the new room, my son (5 yrs old) was walking beside the bed, towards the headboard, and his foot stuck to a sticky paper pest (mouse) trap that had been left there - thankfully, it did not contain any critters. We've been home for 5 days now and have found BED BUGS in my son's room which MUST have come from this hotel. This hotel is attached to the bus station (didn't know that when I booked the reservations) and unfortunately the bad element(s) that hang around bus stations wonder over to the hotel side - didn't feel very safe. The breakfast bar was Ok - the eggs were overcooked and so had a granulated texture. The view from our rooms was of the ghetto behind the hotel. Overall the look of this hotel was nice in the pictures but you can't hide yuck with nice decor once you're in it. I chose this hotel because of the shuttle service, indoor pool and complimentary breakfast - and those were the only perks worth staying at this hotel. Not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A GREAT PLACE TO STAY...”
Reviews.Author: Rollingtravel
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with my family. We stopped for a weekend layover in Baltimore on our way up north. We were pleasantly surprised by the overall service received at this hotel and would definitely recommend it to everyone wanting value, comfort, good service and cleanliness. It started with the girl when we checked in, very nice and very helpful. We were directed to our rooms which were clean, fresh and well maintained. The beds were extremely comfortable! Our stay included a nice breakfast each morning. There was plenty to choose from with a hot buffet type meal. It was free too! One of our family members has special dietary needs and we were very happy that the staff went beyond the norm in making something special both mornings. They even remembered what we needed the 2nd morning. I would definitely stay here again. We received service with a smile and the staff were genuinely welcoming. Try this hotel, it's great service, good location with a shuttle to the inner harbor, and good value which is really important these days. Until my next visit Baltimore......

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and most hospitable staff”
Reviews.Author: travellerCAA
Reviews.Content: Stayed for several nights and found rooms most clean and roomy. Staff was NEVER too busy to answer any questions and were all most friendly. Very convenient to downtown and easy access to 95. Was there for business and was close enough to sights to be visited. Would always recommend and would stay again if necessary to visit area.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: bjfairplay
Reviews.Content: my husband and i enjoyed our stay in baltimore and our experience at this best western. we were pleased at the convenience of the shuttle service which we used to see many downtown attractions. the staff was friendly and courteous and quite helpful to us. and when you visit, be sure to try the blueberry muffins!

Reviews.Title: “Awful experience”
Reviews.Author: Joe10Lancaster_PA
Reviews.Content: Best Western Hotel and Conference Center is located in the middle of a gritty inner-city neighborhood, a sprawling graveyard and the docks. During my stay I experienced a police action in the hallway, rude employees and aggressive beggars. The hotel is built on top of a sooty urban Peter Pan bus terminal. Though there is a card-pass interior security door between the hotel and the bus terminal/video arcade designed to keep the bus people and the hotel guests separate, some homeless folk simply walked around to the front door of the hotel to beg for cigarettes and change. One man asked me if I wanted sex. On my first day, someone down the hall was wailing at the top of their lungs and pounding on the walls. Later, when I tried to go down for some dinner, I had to work my way through a crowd of armed, leather-jacketed Baltimore City police officers and hotel staff blocking the hall where my room was located and who brusquely told me they were trying to eject a "non-paying" guest. When I came back from dinner, they were still standing around the open door of the room, trying to get the crying woman to leave. No one responded to my request to be moved to a quieter, safer, room -- and it sure wasn't because the hotel didn't have any open rooms. And it got worse from there, from an unclean room to rude housekeepers. The whole stay was one awful experience after another. Worse, the staff was, in my opinion, not only utterly unconcerned but seemed to think that this was all very normal and somehow utterly acceptable. Maybe it is at Best Western Hotel and Conference Center. Had I not been taking a seminar at the hotel, I would have checked out immediately. Unbelievable.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: dakota381
Reviews.Content: After reading countless reviews of this hotel, I really wasn't expecting much but when we arrived very late Friday night we had no problems checking in and we were granted a room with a city view. (see picture) I was very happy with how clean the room was and they also came by & straightened up while we were down at the harbor on Saturday. The breakfast buffet had plenty of choices and even the picky teenager ate both mornings. Checkout was quick and easy as well. We did not use the free shuttle, you must schedule it way in advance but it was a very easy drive downtown. The sheets were great even though the beds were a little hard for my taste but all in all we had a very pleasant stay. We plan to use this hotel for any future trips to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Feared for our Safety/adjacent to the Greyhound Travel Plaza-dirty!”
Reviews.Author: witt_9
Reviews.Content: We were amazed when we pulled up to the Hotel after reading great reviews on Trip Advisor and other rating website. This Hotel is ADJACENT to the Greyhound Travel Plaza. A homeless beggar approached us even before we got out of the car and was begging for money and cigarettes and would not leave us alone. We went into the hotel that had dark grime on the walkway. The website for the hotel shows a modern designed lobby, however, the rest of the fixtures are dirty and old. We cancelled our reservation and went to the Inner Harbor for a Hotel. We got a great rate at the Sheraton!! I suggest you do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel at a decent price”
Reviews.Author: Datachick1213
Reviews.Content: We needed a room for one night while we were attending an event and the Best Western was a good choice. Close to I-95 but we couldn't hear the traffic. Room was clean and comfortable, beds were of decent size and had plenty of pillows, bathroom was adequate, TV was good, microwave and refrigerator always a plus. Breakfast buffet was better than expected as it was a hot-food buffet. Hotel and restaurant staff helpful and friendly. Check-in and check-out was quick and easy. Front desk gave us a courtesy call about a 1/2 hour after we checked in to make sure the room was okay. Fast food is in walking distance if needed. Bus station connected to hotel. Easy on/off for I-95. Recommend taking the back streets if you can since the first exit southbound on I-95 was a toll. Short drive to Baltimore harbor area. All in all a nice stay. We would stay here again if we travel to the Baltimore area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: weim99
Reviews.Content: Visited Baltimore Best Western Hotel & Conference Center on Jun 17 and enjoyed the stay. This was our second stay at the hotel and we were not disappointed either time. The lobby was nicely decorated and the front desk staff were friendly and helpful. The room was clean and the high speed internet worked fine. We enjoyed the pool which was located on the first floor and close to the elevator. Our free breakfast in the morning was very good with lots of choices and very friendly staff. We took advantage of the free shuttle to the inner harbor which travelled through Fell's Point via Johns Hopkins. It was a nice tour through parts of Balt. we hadn't seen before. Very nice. All in all, for the price, Baltimore Best Western Hotel & Conference Center is great value for a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Anniversary Get-Away”
Reviews.Author: dsummer20
Reviews.Content: Came for the first time to Baltimore to celebrate our 35 anniversary. Had a rate in mind and it was met. The hotel is right off the interstate but you never hear any noise. The hotel had great service, friendly staff, a free shuttle to the inner harbor and conference center and probably the best thing of all was the dinner theater on the hotel premises! The meal and musical was fantastic. The dinner theater is a must if you enjoy arts. All the staff went out of their way to make you comfortable. The breakfast buffet was excellent and the girl in charge of the early buffet give new and wonderful meaning to smiling and friendliness! We could all take a lesson from her! This trip was exactly what we needed and asked for! Thanks Best Western and CC Baltimore!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: wolfepa
Reviews.Content: The desk people were very friendly/ helpful. The breakfast buffet was an unexpected supprise. I had an appointment at John Hopkins. The shuttle driver knew exactly where to go, everything worked out great. I read other reviews of this hotel & almost changed my reservation because of them. My experience at this hotel was better than average.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were expecting”
Reviews.Author: hydermann
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for the preakness weekend. We arrived at 9 amand our bags were placed in a locked room untill check in time. We still received the free breakfast and use of the shuttle even before our checkin time. Received everything that was promissed. Hourly shuttle to inner harbor was wonderfull. Very polite and friendly drivers. Rooms were clean and entire hotel was very well kept. Breakfast was much better than most complimentary breakfast and waite staff also very friendly and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: tbarker
Reviews.Content: I was there with my wife and 3 grandkids. For $98 (AARP discount), you get a heated pool, a gym, a sauna, a hot tub, free wifi, free breakfast, and free shuttle service to the Inner Harbor. I think this is a GREAT deal, and we'll be back. The room was clean, and the staff were extremely helpful with directions and advice, and were very friendly. And a McDonald's in the parking lot (hey, the grandkids thought that was awesome).

Reviews.Title: “Such a Wonderful weekend!”
Reviews.Author: OhYehMan123
Reviews.Content: After reading a couple reviews on this site before heading down to the hotel, i was alittle worried, but as far as the actual hotel, this place is not to bad other than being located right outside the actual city and a 2 or 3 mile ride to the harbor. The hotel in connected to a baltimore bus center and in between the streets of baltimore neighborhoods. all together is you need a basic place to stay for a night or 2, then this place is for you then. nothing to fancy or special... just a place to basically sleep and leave !

Reviews.Title: “"BEDBUGS ALL OVER MY 80+ YR OLD PARENTS "”
Reviews.Author: tlovely66
Reviews.Content: This is a very nasty and unhealthy hotel. Management doesn't care, the front desk staff are ghetto and trifling. I had my bridal party stay there along with other guest of the wedding and we did not get into our rooms until 4:00 am the morning of the wedding after being there since 10:00 pm after the rehearsal, trying to get the rooms right. They mixed all the rooms up, then they sent two of the guest to rooms that other guest were already in asleep in the beds. To make a long story short. We did not have our bachelorette party, hair/nails did not get done, and to top all that off, we got up at 6:00 am anyhow to go each breakfast, and while there, my sister and I were summons to my 80 yr old mother and 83 year old blind father's room because they woke up in a bed full of chinches (bedbugs) that had bit and rashed them up through the short time they laid there. The room was infested. So bad, the staff didn't want to go in there to clean up the room. One employee had on gloves and had to literally bag up my parents night clothes and put them in a garbage bag, and all the clothes they had laid out on the bed. The hotel management from the bottom to the top did not care, they tried to blow it off. We waited for 4 hour for a GM or DM who ever she was to come to our room to rectify the situation. I was a nervous wreck, we all ended up in one room that we felt was a bit cleaner than the others (had 3 rooms) to try to get ready for the wedding. I was crying, my parents were crying, the bridesmaids were crying, it was a mess. We were hungry and they had the nerve to give us a gift certificate after we asked for food for my Father who was a Diabetic, and for the wedding party because we missed breakfast because of the incident. We ended up eating McDonald's. The wedding was suppose to start at 3:00 pm it didn't start until 4:30 pm and most of the guest were tired and hungry, they left right after the ceremony and didn't come to the reception that didn't start until about 5:45 pm. There was wasted food, wasted money. The only good thing that they offered us was not to pay for the rooms and the exit out of that hell hole of a hotel. What ever you do, don't use this hotel for a wedding, family reunion, or any other event. You will be embarrased, believe me. It was a disaster. We called the police also to make sure that this situation was documented, and that they couldn't say it never happened. True Story.... Do Not Use This Hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Short Stay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RAGDOLLNewYork
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean Place. Overall good experience. room was clean small typical hotel room. internet with connetion and wireless setup in room ,works right on tv screen no charge. free breakfast in am some hot foods make your own waffles etc. dinner theater in hotel which was real nice dinner and a show if you sat there $ 40.00 per person we saw Phantom BUt christmas show coming soon. pool and excerise room dated ,pool was small but clean excerise equip in desperate need of update. Free van shuttle to local hosptials and the inner harbor that was blessing no driving in city traffic. Only drawback was the bus terminal for transit buses is under the hotel. lots of deisel smoke and traffic from them. hotel is set in a transit area, truck stops across the street and lots of bus and truck traffic. you really see them but when they idle for a while you smell them. overall good for short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: BostonFabulous
Reviews.Content: Horrible facility. Horrible food. Horrible service. Upon arrival, they checked us into a double even though we reserved a king. When we went right back down to the lobby the guy said "That room has 2 queens." I said "OK. We would prefer a king." He said "I'm sorry. I've already checked you in. You don't like the room?" I said "Actually, no. We would prefer to have a king bed." He said "Yeah - but I already booked you in." I said "I know. But our reservation is for a king room." He said "OK. But I already booked you in. You don't like the room?" I couldn't believe it. He was purposely talking in circles to avoid the conversation. My husband & I looked at each other with shear disbelief. we had traveled almost 7 hours to get there & neither of us were in the mood for wordplay, so his stupid little stall tactic worked on us. We dragged our bags back up to our room and settled in. Trust me - these were not queen-sized beds. The AC in our room had 2 settings: raging inferno or arctic tundra. I had a really scary moment in the bathroom when I fell HARD on my backside because the flooring was so slippery. The beds were old, saggy and lumpy. They never cleaned our room during our 3-day stay. There were some drops of some kind of sticky brown liquid that remained on the bathroom floor throughout our stay. Yuck. Just so gross. Forget the free shuttle - it's a 14-passenger van that makes only one trip at the top of each hour to the hospital and the Inner Harbor. You can make a "reservation" one day in advance, but good luck getting a seat. This hotel houses hundreds of travelers a day and only 14 people get a ride at the top of each hour??? That is absurd! The van driver takes 2 one hour breaks each day so you can't get a ride between 12-1 & 6-7 either. That was just so frustrating. The food was absolutely horrible. We went to Toby's Dinner Theater and the food was cold and disgusting and those poor kids on stage could barely sing or dance. We went to breakfast the next morning and the food was even more disgusting - synthetic eggs & sausage patties were the only options in the warmers. It was just so gross. Later that morning, we took a $20 cab ride to the Inner Harbor because the guy took us all over creation to get there. Come to find out you can just take O"Donnell Street basically straight back over to the Inner Harbor. We discovered this when we took our $10 cab ride back later that evening. This Best Western isn't on any of the tourist maps, so it's was tough to know if the cabbie was taking us for a ride or not. Later that night, we went into the hotel bar for a nightcap and to watch some of the Olympics, but that bartender was ridiculous. There were about 6 people at the bar and it took her, no joke, 25 minutes to take our drink order! The guy next to us told us to order 2 drinks at a time if we ever did get her attention. I ordered a vodka/tonic and my husband got a bottle of beer. This poor woman had absolutely no idea what she was doing back there and she kept leaving to go into the kitchen for several minutes at a time. We got our drinks approx. 5 minutes after we ordered them. Later that evening, she left the bar altogether for quite a long period of time. It felt like we waited forever to pay our tab. The next morning I called the front desk to get some advice about signing up for a local trolley tour. The front desk lady said "We have nothing to do with that." She couldn't recommend any attractions, tours or restaurants. She couldn't suggest any activities, museums or entertainment. When I asked her if I could speak to someone who could help me, she told me "We're all busy down here." I couldn't believe it. This kind of service is not indicative of the kind of service we have received from other Best Western hotels in the past. We are just so disappointed in this Best Western. From the front-desk staff to the food. From the facility to the customer service. Everything was subpar & VERY disappointing. Our entire stay at this Best Western was a very disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: RobRog
Reviews.Content: My family used the Best Western for our family reunion. The customer service was some of the worst I have ever experienced. One of the excuses was, "the hotel is booked, we have two weddings going on this weekend. Didn't you know this! One of the elevators had yellow warning tape on it for the first two days. Why wasn't staffing appropriately planned for this very busy weekend. Rooms were mediocre. Practically had to beg for towels, toilet paper, etc. Room key malfunctioned up to five times a day. Breakfast was okay. We had a banquet -- food on a scale of 1-5 was a 1.

Reviews.Title: “Easy Access to this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ghesakeeper
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very easy to get to as it is located right off the highway - you can't miss it! Just to let you know there is a truck stop across the street but you cannot hear the trucks when you are in your room, which my room faced and even then I couldn't hear anything. The free shuttle to and from the Harbor was very nice. Just hope there isn't anything going on in town because then the shuttle will hit traffic, which in turn affects the pick-up/drop-off times. Also, at the price I paid, which was $109 plus tax, the free breakfast was a nice perk. I'm not a big breakfast person, but my boyfriend liked it well enough. So if you don't want to stay in the Harbor proper, then this is a nice hotel to stay at. The neighborhood surrounding it isn't that nice, but we only stayed for 1 night so it didn't really bother us that much.

Reviews.Title: “Not for everyone!”
Reviews.Author: sandibeach
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? Well, it's not in a great location but then again the location is the best part of this hotel. Close to the inner-harbor, close to Canton with its cafes and restaurants,close to Little Italy, close to sporting fileds and close to JohnsHopkins. Since I am here on business and not tourism, the proximity to restaurant is most important and it has a bed and fairly clean. Its a basic no frills bestwestern..I have never felt unsafe. Has a weak breakfast which is included. The front desk seems to be nice to me but I do stay alot on business.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Loves2Eat
Reviews.Content: This was my family's second visit to the Best Western on O'Donnell St., and it will be the last. We stayed there because of the shuttle service to/from Johns Hopkins Hospital where my father was undergoing an operation. However, unlike our first visit several years ago, the hotel shuttle no longer keeps early hours (if your operation is prior to 7:30 AM, you're out of luck). We had been told when making reservations that the shuttle ran 24-hours. Not so. This hotel has seriously deteriorated in quality in the four years since we were last there. Would not recommend it for anyone who cannot easily get around on their own. Other problems with hotel: - Room not clean: found a long hair hanging out of the coffee maker. - Housekeeping skipped our room for no apparent reason, and no explanation was given. By the time we returned (after 4PM), my father was convalescing on the bed and it would have been inappropriate to have housekeeping come in as they offered to do (after 4 PM!) - 50% of the light bulbs were burned out in the room. - Wireless service intermittent. - A simple grilled cheese sandwich ordered in the restaurant came out cold and with a strange taste. Other food barely edible. - Lobby bathroom out of order our first night there, which meant a trip back upstairs for elderly people. - Hot tub not working in the "pool" area. - Surly front desk staff the morning we checked out. A simple question was met with hostility and attitude. - Very little service orientation at this hotel. Some staff are friendly enough, but it's clear that there is no real management of services. Definitely do not recommend eating at the restaurant unless it's the breakfast buffet (the only bright spot about the place).

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: banker95
Reviews.Content: We spent a night at this hotel to visit Toby's Dinner Theater and the service was wonderful. The lobby was very nice and the rooms were great. I actually felt at home with the staff. The shuttle driver that took us to the Harbor was very nice and fun to be around. We found it a joy to tip him for his service. (He never mentioned a tip to us). I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Although the bus terminal is connected to this hotel, you would not know it unless you look that way. I had 22 guest with me and everyone enjoyed this hotel. I will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I would have known better”
Reviews.Author: TrvlGrl77
Reviews.Content: For some reason, my excitement about attending the Stevie Wonder concert in Baltimore weakened my good senses and I didn't research reviews on TripAdvisor before booking this hotel! Imagine my surprise when I discovered that the bus terminal was attached to this hotel. Buses get a bad rap..and for good reason! The hotel itself wasn't terrible, but some of the lowlights were 1) twice calling to ask for towels, only to have to go downstairs to the front desk to get some 2) the maintenance staff coming in to move the fridge and microwave, but leaving the beds unmade, dirty towels on the floor, and trash unemptied 3) the shuttle driver informing us that we "should tip him" after remarking that he goes home at 11p (even though shuttle service is until 11:30p) and that he wasn't getting paid to pick us up 4) after being told to go thru the dining hall door to get to the gift shop, someone locked the door behind us and since the other door was chained shut (is that legal?), we had to scurry around the corner before Avon Barksdale rode the bus in from prison. The staff was courteous and not bad for the money, but I would NEVER stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, good for Johns Hopkins patients”
Reviews.Author: DrivingSoul
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night when I had an appointment at Johns Hopkins. Although the Outpatient Clinic was a good drive away (taxi $15), the hotel offers a free daily shuttle service which is great. The location of the hotel is great for drivers coming from out of town as it is right off the highway, close to a truck stop, McDonald's and a food court (could have healthier food choices though!). This Best Western is also adjacent to the bus terminal for those traveling by Greyhound. Hotel room was spacious and very clean. Shower pressure was a little too low for my liking but seeing as how the bathroom was very clean, I didn't mind too much. I've attached a picture of the amenities found upon my arrival. Buffet breakfast was plenty. Staff very friendly and helpful. Cons: The Greyhound bus terminal area could use a renovation and healthier food outlets would be nice. The store needed restocking in items such as milk and water.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: stumpsr
Reviews.Content: I booked this reservation online some 8 months earlier in January. My son and I were in Baltimore for one night to see two Red Sox/Orioles games, we had flown into Washington and drove a rental up to Baltimore. Originally the Saturday game was scheduled for 7pm but due to national TV was moved to 3:55. Checkin at the hotel was 4pm. Due to the new gametime we went directly to the hotel to check in and give our credit card information. We did this at 1pm. The hotel took our credit card, gave us a parking pass, booked us on their shuttle to the Inner Harbor and booked us on a return shuttle at 11:30 pm after the game. They told us that rooms were presently not ready and that our key would be waiting when we got back. After the game most of the restraunts in the inner harbor had two hour waits so we decided at 9pm to take a cab back to the hotel, shower, eat somewhere close and take a cab back to go to the ESPNZone. When we got back to the hotel there was commotion at the reservation desk and the manager on duty wanted to speak to me off to the side. He told me that there was a problem with the pipes in four of the rooms and that as the hotel was full that these four rooms needed to be moved to another hotel. One of these people was us. The only available hotel was a Days Inn which was 20 miles north on rte 95. Needless to say I was not happy and could not understand why we were chosen as we were there at 1pm. I still dont understand. The people at the hotel said it was because we had a car. When I booked the hotel I had an AAA discount with a price of $118 per night, most of the hotels in the inner harbor were going for over $300 per night. My son noticed that behind the desk that there was a sign stating not to honor discounts for weekends when the Orioles play either the Red Sox or the Yankees. Were we part of this policy? Did they find someone to rent for $300 for the night and stick us in a fleebag with a rate of $72? This ruined our night which we had been looking forward to for more than half a year. We ended up driving an additional 5 or 10 miles out of the way to find the only open restraunt, a TGI Fridays and eating dinner at 10pm. We were not compensated for gas. Had to get up earlier on Sunday morning than we wanted to in order to backtrack the 20 miles. Never had time for breakfast. What would the hotel had done if we had gone to the ESPNZone after the game and had been drinking? With shuttle and cab service available we more than likely would not have been able to drive. Never ever again will I step foot into a Best Western.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: sunnieday
Reviews.Content: We arrived Fri. evening before the preakness race. Check in was a breeze.Our room safe did not work properly, hotel maintenance came immediately to fix it. He was very friendly and pleasant. Rooms were clean and I am very picky about that.If you put your housekeeping tag on the door , they will clean again for you the next day.The only negatives are the bar needs to stay open later and the breakfast buffet needs to be monitered more efficiently.We had to wait for some items to be replenished.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: jules089
Reviews.Content: Hotel is okay but the staff(except the pool boy) was the most unfriendly, unhappy group of people. room was comfy, bathroom was a nice size.Liked the breakfast,shuttle and gift shop. Noisy on weekends!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty & Unfriendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: eastpetersburg
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving to the hotel, we joined the many guests standing around in the lobby waiting for our rooms to be ready, this was at 6PM, 3 hours after our check-in time. Finally we were checked in by the less-than-friendly front desk staff, and went up to our rooms. We found used condoms in the trash can in one of the rooms, hair on the bed, and dirty bathroom. It looked like housekeeping did a rush job of the cleaning of the room. Our 2nd room was just as bad, only the tub in the bathrrom actually was BLACK on the bottom, instead of ivory. The black was mold or dirt built up on the bottom. When brought to the attention of management, they commented "What the [--] are those [--] doing down there, I'm gonna have to have a talk with them." in those exact words. The N word was used quite often by staff members... I also was told "Oh, you guys are nit-pickers" when I first complained about the room. The hotel is in a terrible location, but offers convenient shuttle services. I would not come back here again, after the bad experiance we had with 2 rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: family1997
Reviews.Content: While I was concerned to stay here after reading the reviews I was pleasantly surprised at the cleanliness and courtesy at this hotel. The shuttle was easy to get and took you right into Inner Harbor and Camden Yards, so we did not have to fight the traffic or deal with finding parking. The hotel staff was very friendly and the room was very clean. The bus terminal is attached but did not find that a problem. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “This Best Western isn't the best”
Reviews.Author: dsb2
Reviews.Content: Our room was quite large, but there were problems with the service. After repeated requests to the front desk for bed linens for the pull-out sofa, we finally had to go down to the front desk and get them ourselves. The TV didn't work, although that was fixed the next day. The water pressure in the shower was poor. The continental breakfast buffet was adequate, and the swimming pool is tiny. The hotel's best feature is the free shuttle service to the Inner Harbor, Camden Yards, etc. However, space on the hourly shuttle is limited, so you need to reserve your spot as early as possible. Since the hotel is connected to the Baltimore Travel Center (formerly known as a bus station), there are some interesting people wandering around the area. You can't beat the price, though, compared to the downtown/Inner Harbor hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK - Location BAD”
Reviews.Author: GOMSUDogs
Reviews.Content: The Hotel rooms themselves are better than average; however, the location and parking are horrible. The Greyhound Bus Terminal is attached directly to the hotel; therefore, folks not staying at the hotel tend to wander around the front door and in the parking area. There is also not enough parking available for hotel guests. While we were there, one guest had to park in the McDonald's lot directly in front of the hotel and their car was towed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Reno, but terrible location and connection to transient TravelCenter”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has been recently renovated and looks great. But I did not know that it was connected to the Bus Terminal, which was quite filthy from the outside. It takes so much away from the newly rennovated hotel. Plus since it is located in the middle of the hood - the travel center just gives it a creepy transient feel, like there are wanderers about....

Reviews.Title: “Clean inside, noisy location”
Reviews.Author: indigo1968
Reviews.Content: I had no complaints about service for this hotel. My room was clean and well-ventilated. However, the hotel is parked beside the noisy I-95, and attached to a slightly scuzzy bus terminal. The hotel was also tricky to find for visitors unfamiliar with the Baltimore area. Still, the price made up for a lot of the downsides, so I do not regret having stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Sept.9-11 The staff went out there way to help us very friendley and helpfull.The shuttle was great.It was nice to not to thinking about trying to drive downtown baltimore. Make sure to get to the loby 15 min. before you are ready to leave and when you want to go back to the hotel too. We did have a little probem with the shuttle they over booked. There are only so many people that can get on. So we left. The people who were not there on time had a cow because they booked the shuttle the night before so they turned around to get them. We were not that far away so it was not a big deal. We used the shuttle the next day and had no problems. The breakfast had a nice varreity the staff was nice. Would stay their again P.S We got a great price for the room $118.00 from AAA

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Hotel & Conference Center
HotelInfo.Address: 5625 O'Donnell Street, Baltimore, MD 21224
